20101227230118.000|20101227230120.000|TR0|Afghanistan, there's a growing threat to 
20101227230120.000|20101227230123.000|TR0|U.S. forces, one that most Americans have 
20101227230123.000|20101227230126.000|TR0|not even heard of. It's a group of 
20101227230126.000|20101227230128.000|TR0|fighters fiercely loyal to one family.

20101227230131.000|20101227230134.000|TR0|a key member.  But now we are learning 
20101227230134.000|20101227230136.000|TR0|that may not be the case at all.

20101227230155.000|20101227230157.000|TR0|BARBARA STARR, CNN PENTAGON CORRESPONDENT: 
20101227230157.000|20101227230200.000|TR0| Well, that's the name to remember, 
20101227230200.000|20101227230203.000|TR0|Suzanne.  A lot of Americans haven't heard 
20101227230203.000|20101227230205.000|TR0|a lot about them, but the Haqqani Network, 
20101227230205.000|20101227230208.000|TR0|who are the Haqqanis?
20101227230208.000|20101227230210.000|TR0|
20101227230210.000|20101227230213.000|TR0|A family of fighters once loyal to the CIA 
20101227230213.000|20101227230216.000|TR0|now fighting and attacking U.S. forces.
20101227230216.000|20101227230218.000|TR0|
20101227230218.000|20101227230221.000|TR0|(BEGIN VIDEOTAPE)
20101227230221.000|20101227230224.000|TR0|
20101227230224.000|20101227230226.000|TR0|STARR (voice-over):  In Eastern 
20101227230226.000|20101227230229.000|TR0|Afghanistan, U.S. troops hope to start 
20101227230229.000|20101227230232.000|TR0|coming home in months, but the reality may 
20101227230232.000|20101227230234.000|TR0|be different.  Here, attacks are rising.  
20101227230234.000|20101227230237.000|TR0|But it's not from the Taliban or al Qaeda. 
20101227230237.000|20101227230239.000|TR0| The number-one threat, fighters loyal to 
20101227230239.000|20101227230242.000|TR0|this man, Jalaluddin Haqqani, the leader 
20101227230242.000|20101227230245.000|TR0|of the group known as the Haqqani Network.
20101227230245.000|20101227230247.000|TR0|
20101227230247.000|20101227230250.000|TR0|The top U.S. commander in the east has 
20101227230250.000|20101227230253.000|TR0|Haqqani in his crosshairs.      MAJ. GEN. 
20101227230253.000|20101227230255.000|TR0|JOHN CAMPBELL, REGION COMMAND EAST:  We 
20101227230255.000|20101227230258.000|TR0|focus really on the Haqqani Network as one 
20101227230258.000|20101227230301.000|TR0|of the most important insurgent networks 
20101227230301.000|20101227230303.000|TR0|here in Afghanistan.  I believe it's the 
20101227230303.000|20101227230306.000|TR0|biggest threat to Kabul because of their 
20101227230306.000|20101227230308.000|TR0|location and how close they are the Kabul 
20101227230308.000|20101227230311.000|TR0|and the objectives they want to get at.
20101227230311.000|20101227230314.000|TR0|
20101227230314.000|20101227230316.000|TR0|STARR:  Haqqani fighters have stayed out 
20101227230316.000|20101227230319.000|TR0|of Kabul lately, but their overall success 
20101227230319.000|20101227230322.000|TR0|at trying to control territory and attack 
20101227230322.000|20101227230324.000|TR0|the Afghan government could risk the U.S. 
20101227230324.000|20101227230327.000|TR0|war plan.
20101227230327.000|20101227230330.000|TR0|
20101227230330.000|20101227230332.000|TR0|CAMPBELL:  They have no issues with 
20101227230332.000|20101227230335.000|TR0|recruiting.  They go into madrassas inside 
20101227230335.000|20101227230337.000|TR0|of Pakistan, and they can come in very 
20101227230337.000|20101227230340.000|TR0|large numbers.
20101227230340.000|20101227230343.000|TR0|
20101227230343.000|20101227230345.000|TR0|STARR:  A major problem, the Haqqanis also 
20101227230345.000|20101227230348.000|TR0|operate inside Pakistan, sending a 
20101227230348.000|20101227230351.000|TR0|constant flow of weapons and fighters into 
20101227230351.000|20101227230353.000|TR0|Afghanistan.  They control a region 
20101227230353.000|20101227230356.000|TR0|running from Khost in Eastern Afghanistan 
20101227230356.000|20101227230359.000|TR0|across the border into Miranshah and then 
20101227230359.000|20101227230401.000|TR0|into Pakistan's North Waziristan region.
20101227230401.000|20101227230404.000|TR0|
20101227230404.000|20101227230406.000|TR0|Last week, Pakistani intelligence 
20101227230406.000|20101227230409.000|TR0|officials said they arrested Nasiruddin 
20101227230409.000|20101227230412.000|TR0|Haqqani, the leader's son, on the road 
20101227230412.000|20101227230414.000|TR0|from Peshawar into North Waziristan.  It 
20101227230414.000|20101227230417.000|TR0|would have been a huge intelligence coup. 
20101227230417.000|20101227230420.000|TR0|Nasiruddin is considered the moneyman.
20101227230420.000|20101227230422.000|TR0|
20101227230422.000|20101227230425.000|TR0|But a U.S. official says there's doubt the 
20101227230425.000|20101227230428.000|TR0|incident ever happened, telling CNN, 
20101227230428.000|20101227230430.000|TR0|"There's been no indication that 
20101227230430.000|20101227230433.000|TR0|Nasiruddin was detained recently."
20101227230433.000|20101227230435.000|TR0|
20101227230435.000|20101227230438.000|TR0|A senior U.S. military official tells CNN 
20101227230438.000|20101227230441.000|TR0|there's every reason to believe the 
20101227230441.000|20101227230443.000|TR0|Pakistani intelligent service, the ISI, 
20101227230443.000|20101227230446.000|TR0|protects the Haqqani Network, something 
20101227230446.000|20101227230449.000|TR0|Pakistan officially denies.  But some 
20101227230449.000|20101227230451.000|TR0|believe there's easy proof.  The arrest 
20101227230451.000|20101227230454.000|TR0|may have been an effort by the Pakistanis 
20101227230454.000|20101227230457.000|TR0|to show they were cracking down.
20101227230457.000|20101227230459.000|TR0|

20101227230504.000|20101227230507.000|TR0|service at a minimum turns a blind eye, 
20101227230507.000|20101227230510.000|TR0|because if they were actively fighting

20101227230512.000|20101227230515.000|TR0|successful by now.

20101227230727.000|20101227230729.000|TR0|but they come together to fight a common

20101227230907.000|20101227230910.000|TR0|actually trust Pakistan?

20101227230912.000|20101227230915.000|TR0|TOWNSEND:  Well, I think in fairness, what 
20101227230915.000|20101227230918.000|TR0|you're hearing -- Barbara interviewed 
20101227230918.000|20101227230920.000|TR0|General Campbell.  I had been in the 
20101227230920.000|20101227230923.000|TR0|region.  I saw General Campbell and 
20101227230923.000|20101227230925.000|TR0|General Petraeus.  You talk to U.S. and

20101227230931.000|20101227230933.000|TR0|of course, they see people like the

20101227230936.000|20101227230939.000|TR0|coming from Pakistan -- bad guys coming 
20101227230939.000|20101227230941.000|TR0|from Pakistan into Afghanistan.

20101227230947.000|20101227230949.000|TR0|base in Khost was overrun.  And that could

20101227230952.000|20101227230954.000|TR0|of the Haqqani Network.  And so there's

20101227231047.000|20101227231050.000|TR0|
20101227231050.000|20101227231052.000|TR0|MALVEAUX:  And on another subject, Fran, 
20101227231052.000|20101227231055.000|TR0|"The Washington Post" had a story today 
20101227231055.000|20101227231058.000|TR0|about planes that cross over the United 
20101227231058.000|20101227231100.000|TR0|States, whether they're delivering cargo 
20101227231100.000|20101227231103.000|TR0|or passengers to other countries. They 
20101227231103.000|20101227231106.000|TR0|don't land in the United States.  They 
20101227231106.000|20101227231108.000|TR0|don't go through the same federal 
20101227231108.000|20101227231111.000|TR0|screening processes as those planes that 
20101227231111.000|20101227231114.000|TR0|actually land in the United States.
20101227231114.000|20101227231116.000|TR0|
20101227231116.000|20101227231119.000|TR0|Is that a security hole in our system?
20101227231119.000|20101227231121.000|TR0|
20101227231121.000|20101227231124.000|TR0|TOWNSEND:  It is, Suzanne.
20101227231124.000|20101227231127.000|TR0|
20101227231127.000|20101227231129.000|TR0|I mean, one of the things you hope to do 
20101227231129.000|20101227231132.000|TR0|through international organizations like 
20101227231132.000|20101227231135.000|TR0|ICAO International Civil Aviation 
20101227231135.000|20101227231137.000|TR0|Organization, is to set best practices and 
20101227231137.000|20101227231140.000|TR0|minimum standards, but it is a hole.  We 
20101227231140.000|20101227231143.000|TR0|don't control screening for the whole 
20101227231143.000|20101227231145.000|TR0|world.  We try to enforce best practices.
20101227231145.000|20101227231148.000|TR0|
20101227231148.000|20101227231150.000|TR0|MALVEAUX:  All right, Fran, Fran Townsend, 
20101227231150.000|20101227231153.000|TR0|thank you so much for joining us today.

20101227232329.000|20101227232332.000|TR0|they take.  That will be reserved probably 
20101227232332.000|20101227232334.000|TR0|for a bill that deals with the economy or 
20101227232334.000|20101227232337.000|TR0|jobs.  But we will likely see this 
20101227232337.000|20101227232340.000|TR0|dramatic vote before the president gives 
20101227232340.000|20101227232342.000|TR0|his State of the Union address.
20101227232342.000|20101227232345.000|TR0|
20101227232345.000|20101227232348.000|TR0|(voice-over):  Scrapping what critics 
20101227232348.000|20101227232350.000|TR0|derisively call Obamacare, it's a vote 
20101227232350.000|20101227232353.000|TR0|House Republicans promised their 
20101227232353.000|20101227232356.000|TR0|supporters, especially Tea Party voters, 
20101227232356.000|20101227232358.000|TR0|whose anger helped sweep them into the 
20101227232358.000|20101227232401.000|TR0|majority.

20101227232406.000|20101227232409.000|TR0|gavel, and he is promising to:
20101227232409.000|20101227232411.000|TR0|
20101227232411.000|20101227232414.000|TR0|REP. JOHN BOEHNER (R-OH), HOUSE MINORITY 
20101227232414.000|20101227232417.000|TR0|LEADER:  Repeal this monstrosity and 
20101227232417.000|20101227232419.000|TR0|replace it with commonsense reforms that 
20101227232419.000|20101227232422.000|TR0|will bring down the cost of health 
20101227232422.000|20101227232425.000|TR0|insurance in America.
20101227232425.000|20101227232427.000|TR0|
20101227232427.000|20101227232430.000|TR0|KEILAR:  New polls numbers show most 
20101227232430.000|20101227232432.000|TR0|Americans have big problems with health 
20101227232432.000|20101227232435.000|TR0|care reform.  They either think it's too 
20101227232435.000|20101227232438.000|TR0|far-reaching or doesn't do enough.  Like 
20101227232438.000|20101227232440.000|TR0|Republicans, six in 10 people surveyed 
20101227232440.000|20101227232443.000|TR0|oppose a requirement that everyone buy 
20101227232443.000|20101227232446.000|TR0|health insurance, according to a new 
20101227232446.000|20101227232448.000|TR0|CNN/Opinion Research Corporation poll.
20101227232448.000|20101227232451.000|TR0|
20101227232451.000|20101227232454.000|TR0|But many Americans favor other reforms -- 
20101227232454.000|20101227232456.000|TR0|61 percent support stopping health 
20101227232456.000|20101227232459.000|TR0|insurance companies from dropping coverage 
20101227232459.000|20101227232501.000|TR0|for the seriously ill -- 64 percent are 
20101227232501.000|20101227232504.000|TR0|happy insurance companies won't be able to 
20101227232504.000|20101227232507.000|TR0|deny coverage on the basis of a 
20101227232507.000|20101227232509.000|TR0|preexisting condition.
20101227232509.000|20101227232512.000|TR0|

20101227232515.000|20101227232517.000|TR0|After all, Democrats are still in charge

20101227232922.000|20101227232925.000|TR0|JESSICA YELLIN, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  I 
20101227232925.000|20101227232928.000|TR0|spoke with a senior official at Health and 
20101227232928.000|20101227232930.000|TR0|Human Services who explained it this way, 
20101227232930.000|20101227232933.000|TR0|Suzanne.  Under -- when President Bush was 
20101227232933.000|20101227232936.000|TR0|in office, he signed into law a provision 
20101227232936.000|20101227232938.000|TR0|that allowed doctors to discuss with a 
20101227232938.000|20101227232941.000|TR0|patient what their end-of-life directives 
20101227232941.000|20101227232944.000|TR0|would be.  Do they want to be kept alive 
20101227232944.000|20101227232946.000|TR0|if they're on a ventilator or not, that 
20101227232946.000|20101227232949.000|TR0|kind of thing.  But only during a one-time 
20101227232949.000|20101227232951.000|TR0|visit that they get at the beginning of 
20101227232951.000|20101227232954.000|TR0|their Medicare benefits.
20101227232954.000|20101227232957.000|TR0|
20101227232957.000|20101227232959.000|TR0|When you first become eligible, you get 
20101227232959.000|20101227233002.000|TR0|this one-time visit.  You can have this 
20101227233002.000|20101227233005.000|TR0|discussion.
20101227233005.000|20101227233007.000|TR0|
20101227233007.000|20101227233010.000|TR0|MALVEAUX:  Sure.
20101227233010.000|20101227233013.000|TR0|
20101227233013.000|20101227233015.000|TR0|YELLIN:  Well, the new law, the 
20101227233015.000|20101227233018.000|TR0|health-care law, made that visit happen 
20101227233018.000|20101227233020.000|TR0|every year.  It's part of preventative 
20101227233020.000|20101227233023.000|TR0|care, so you can have that overall 
20101227233023.000|20101227233026.000|TR0|wellness check-up where they check your 
20101227233026.000|20101227233028.000|TR0|cholesterol, and if you're a woman, you 
20101227233028.000|20101227233031.000|TR0|get a mammogram.  What pills are you on?  
20101227233031.000|20101227233034.000|TR0|They go through a check list of all sorts 
20101227233034.000|20101227233036.000|TR0|of things.  And the end-of-life planning

20101227233505.000|20101227233508.000|TR0|at the State Department with details.
20101227233508.000|20101227233510.000|TR0|
20101227233510.000|20101227233513.000|TR0|Jill, this is a very interesting story.  
20101227233513.000|20101227233516.000|TR0|Tell us what this is about.
20101227233516.000|20101227233518.000|TR0|
20101227233518.000|20101227233521.000|TR0|JILL DOUGHERTY, CNN CORRESPONDENT:  Yes, 
20101227233521.000|20101227233524.000|TR0|it is.  You know, Suzanne, as I was
